intro: Eriolobus tschonoskii, commonly known as the Tschonoskii eriolobus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, woolly leaves. It produces clusters of pale yellow or greenish flowers, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Eriolobus tschonoskii is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
